question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Besides the content of this class just being really interesting, I really appreciated how organised the class structure was and how we followed architecture chronologically with a different period each week. Professor Galletti was always extremely clear and made the information really digestable without making it overly simplified or boring. I really enjoyed our coursework just being drawings instead of the more conventional writing tasks; it was an appropriate and really interesting way to learn about architecture and spaces. The exams are also straightforward, but still require a great understanding and knowledge of what we have learned.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: they were very descriptive and explained topics in digestible ways.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Since I was doing my own drawings every week I became much more proficient in evaluating plans, elevations, and pictures of buildings and reproducing them on pen and paper. This will be helpful for me in the future as I intend to engage with architectural plans often as a structural engineer.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I found the content really interesting in itself, however I really enjoyed also how Professor Galletti always placed the buildings and periods of architecture we studied in context in order to build an overall picture of how architecture progressed throughout history. I loved how we did not just look at the buildings, but also thought about their function, what was happening in history that influenced their design, the connection to society, etc.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Do not take this course, you will be struggling to not fall asleep every day, and you do not really even learn anything. It is not even an easy A because the exams count too much.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: This is among my favourite classes that I have ever taken at Duke. Professor Galletti is an incredibly engaging lecturer and the class is extremely well organised and taught, beyond being just really interesting. I felt like Professor Galletti gave a really complete overview without sacrificing on details or needing to "dumb it down" because we covered such a huge period of time. She also always answered questions really well. If she had an intro class on just art as well I would take it! Because of this class I am now taking another art history class next semester even though it is very unrelated to my main interests and major.
